page.title: 13BOYTON HALL FARM
page.content: Boyton Hall has 1500 acres and a small work force of 9(6 on the land and 3 looking after the pigs.) All the crops are arable, they are, wheat,potatoes,peas,barley and sugar beet. These are grown in fifty fields. The sowing and harvesting are the most important times of the year.Normal working times are from 7a.m. to 6p.m. though during harvest time it lasts from 7a.m. to 9p.m.However the new technology of combine harvesters ,8 tractors and 2 fork lifters help. When the harvest is all in the potatoes go to London, the wheat to the mills, barley into beer,peas are canned and sent to the shop and the pigs are sent to the markets. The family who own the farm have lived there 39 years but have only owned it 2 years.
